title: Why do we discover something great platform and get to know it was discovered many years ago? - Quora

response.answer_text: Q: Why do we discover something great platform and get to know it was discovered many years ago? I may be misinterpreting your question but will take the risk answering. A very famous physicist, Richard Feynman, took considerable joy in things “discovered many years” prior and rebuilding them from scratch. This means he probably understood those things better than most and afforded him the ability to extend those ideas. You see —- until you really understand the foundation built by others, and in your own unique way, it's very difficult to extend that knowledge into new areas. No one on the planet can have totally unique contributions. Knowledge is built on the sweat, pain, and joy of our predecessors.
A: No, you are gravely mistaken if you think that way 😏  Original Q: Why do we discover something great platform and get to know it was discovered many years ago?
